content:
I'm so glad you liked the snack ideas! Fresh fruit cups and trail mix are perfect for a quick and healthy snack.

And, oh, yes! I have plenty of healthy dinner recipes that can be cooked in under 30 minutes. Here are some delicious and quick options:

**One-Pot Wonders**

1. **Quinoa and Black Bean Bowl**: Cook quinoa, black beans, diced tomatoes, and your choice of protein (like chicken or tofu) in one pot. Season with cumin and chili powder. (20 minutes)
2. **Spaghetti with Tomato Sauce**: Cook spaghetti, canned tomatoes, garlic, and olive oil in one pot. Add your choice of protein (like turkey meatballs or sautéed chicken). (20 minutes)
3. **Lentil Soup**: Cook lentils, diced veggies, and your choice of broth in one pot. Season with thyme and rosemary. (25 minutes)

**Stir-Fry Favorites**

1. **Chicken and Veggie Stir-Fry**: Cook diced chicken and your favorite veggies (like bell peppers, broccoli, and carrots) in a wok or large skillet with some oil and soy sauce. Serve with brown rice or cauliflower rice. (15 minutes)
2. **Shrimp and Snow Pea Stir-Fry**: Cook shrimp, snow peas, and your favorite veggies (like bell peppers and onions) in a wok or large skillet with some oil and soy sauce. Serve with brown rice or cauliflower rice. (15 minutes)
3. **Veggie and Tofu Stir-Fry**: Cook diced tofu and your favorite veggies (like broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers) in a wok or large skillet with some oil and soy sauce. Serve with brown rice or cauliflower rice. (15 minutes)

**Oven-Ready**

1. **Baked Salmon and Veggies**: Season salmon fillets with lemon juice and herbs. Bake in the oven with your favorite veggies (like asparagus and Brussels sprouts) for 12-15 minutes.
2. **Chicken Fajitas**: Season chicken breast with fajita seasoning. Bake in the oven with sliced bell peppers and onions for 15-20 minutes. Serve with whole wheat tortillas and your favorite toppings.
3. **Roasted Veggies and Quinoa Bowl**: Toss your favorite veggies (like sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts, and cauliflower) with oil and seasoning. Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes. Serve over quinoa with a dollop of tzatziki sauce.

These dinner recipes are quick, healthy, and can be customized to fit your dietary preferences and ingredient availability.

How do these ideas sound? Do you have any specific dinner preferences or dietary restrictions I can take into account?
